tiles.title: Github Projects
tiles.text: Some of my cooler github projects. Made with ♥ and coffee beans.

tiles.title: Who am i?
tiles.text: A little about who I am and what I get up to.
tiles.backHTML:
Who am I?

Hi, I’m Josh! I am an infrastructure and software engineer based in the United Kingdom.

I love solving problems with clean code and brain waves. You’ll usually find me at the gym, breaking something (and then fixing it) or knee deep in a personal project.

You can find a few links and demonstrations of my work displayed on this website.

I currently work as a middlware engineer for the NatWest group.

tiles.title: p5Gravitation
tiles.text: Manipulate gravity with your mouse, coded using the p5.js library.
tiles.backHTML:
p5Gravitation

Move the mouse or a finger around and the gravity will follow.

Scroll the wheel or adjust the top slider to vary the gravity offset.

Source code is available here.

tiles.title: jsTetris
tiles.text: A basic implementation of Tetris, coded in Python using Pygame, compiled to JavaScript using Pyjs with Pyjsdl.
tiles.backHTML:
jsTetris

Keyboard controls are as follows:

KeyAction
left arrowmove left
right arrowmove right
zrotate left
xrotate right
down arrowsoft drop
spacehard drop
ppause
rrestart

Use the buttons to the right of the grid if you lack a keyboard.

Source code is available here.

tiles.title: p5Pong
tiles.text: A simple Pong clone, coded using the p5.js library.
tiles.backHTML:
p5Pong

Move the mouse or a finger around and the left paddle will follow.

Double click inside the game window or press 'p' to (un)pause.

Source code is available here.

tiles.title: About this website
tiles.text: A little about what this website runs on and how you can create your own home server
tiles.backHTML:
About this website

The website you are currently browsing is self hosted on a bad boy like the one to the right. It is a thin client, the type of low power device you may find in a large company that’s sole purpose is to log in to a more powerful machine over the network.

The CPU is not intensive enough to even require a fan. This makes it ideal for a low cost server. It is currently running Debian Linux and hosts a number of web services.

If you find yourself in need of a low cost, low power home server, I would highly recommend parkytowers (here) as a place to start.
